entries.title: Google thinks a US Supreme Court case could radically change the internet
entries.description: Current law Interpretation protects tech companies from being liable for content moderation decisions made by artificial intelligence, but that could be changing.

entries.title: Windows 11 preview build makes it easier to learn why your computer crashes
entries.description: Microsoft begins planning for the future of troubleshooting with a new memory dump tool and the end of MSDT.

entries.title: Facebook Creator Studio shuts down, rebrands as Meta Business Suite
entries.description: Meta Business Suite will now be the place to go for all things business, as Creator Studio reaches the end of the line.

entries.title: Hackers target and exploit major Control Web Panel security flaw
entries.description: Flaw allows Control Web Panel hackers to execute malicious code remotely, but a fix is available.

entries.title: Huge TF2 leak reveals scrapped weapons and maps
entries.description: The latest Team Fortress 2 leak has revealed pretty much everything about the game.

entries.title: The US Army is spending millions on developing a new Microsoft HoloLens headset

entries.title: Assassin's Creed Mirage looks to fix my biggest problem with Valhalla

entries.title: Nintendo Switch OLED vs Nintendo Switch: what's different?
entries.description: Is the Nintendo Switch OLED worth upgrading to? Find out what it offers over the classic Switch in our versus.

entries.title: The Fitbit Charge 5 crashes to a record-low price in massive Fitbit sale at Amazon
entries.description: Amazon is offering some fantastic Fitbit deals, including the Fitbit Charge 5 on sale for a record-low price of $99.99.

entries.title: UK illegal sport streamers to be visited by authorities amid major piracy crackdown
entries.description: Amid a major piracy crackdown, authorities seek to warn illegal IPTV services' users about the criminal and data privacy risks.

entries.title: Many firms aren't giving remote workers any security training
entries.description: Access to sensitive files for those without proper training could be a recipe for disaster.

entries.title: Personal and employee data is a goldmine for hackers
entries.description: Passwords and payment data theft plummets as PII proves a bigger lure.

entries.description: From eagerly anticipated video game adaptations to returning historical dramas, there’s plenty to watch this weekend.

entries.title: Intel Lunar Lake CPUs could revolutionize ultrathin laptops

entries.title: Groov-e's super-cheap soundbars want to give your budget TV an easy upgrade
entries.description: With four options to choose from, Groov-e’s first range of soundbars look like a solid choice to boost the audio on your cheap TV.

entries.title: The beat stops for Groove Music in Windows 10 as it's replaced by Media Player
entries.description: With the rebooted Windows Media Player available in Windows 10, Groove Music is being sent to the app graveyard.

entries.description: Hackers are using known VPN vulnerabilities to target government endpoints.

entries.title: A new Chromecast with Google TV is coming – here's what we want to see

entries.description: Oculus founder Palmer Luckey is very impressed with PSVR 2. Does that bode well for the VR headset's future?

entries.title: An annoying iPhone 14 Pro bug will soon be fixed
entries.description: Apple has acknowledged a bug causing horizontal lines to appear on the iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max, and a fix is coming.

entries.title: Nvidia's streaming software can now deepfake your eyes to make sure you're looking at the camera
entries.description: Nvidia AI eye contact tool looks to help content creators engage with their audience.

entries.title: HBO's The Last of Us is coming to Prime Video in France – so why not everywhere?
entries.description: The Last of Us TV show will be available to stream on Prime Video in France, but you'll still be able to watch it elsewhere.

entries.title: Ryzen CPU firmware bug is fixed, but AMD has bigger problems
